intro: Gamochaeta rosacea, commonly known as the pinkhead panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly in the southeastern region. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, pinkish flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a flowering period that occurs in late summer to early fall. Gamochaeta rosacea is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt and waterlogged conditions.
